newsitem.title: JORDAN: Hamas criticises building plans in Jerusalem.
newsitem.headline: Hamas criticises building plans in Jerusalem.

text.p: The Islamic resistance movement Hamas on Thursday strongly criticised an Israeli decision to build homes for Jews in Arab East Jerusalem and warned that Israel may not be able to contain Palestinian anger.

"This is a very important and dangerous decision," Hamas spokesman Ibrahim Ghosheh told Reuters. "In the near future maybe the Palestinian Authority and Israel will be able to control the (Palestinian) reaction, but the bulldozers will start in two weeks, and who can say what will happen."
"The Palestinian people feel they have a knife on their hearts and they will want to express their pain with strong demonstrations," Ghosheh said.

He said he expected a timid response from Palestinian President Yasser Arafat and other Arab leaders to the Israeli decision to build 6,500 houses for Jews in Jabal Abu Ghneim, called Har Homa by Israel.
"But Arab and Moslem people will not accept this step and will try to express their rejection," he said, adding that anger could spill over during Friday weekly Moslem prayers .
"Tomorrow is Friday -- all the mosques will be surrounded by guards, but no one can tell what will happen," he said.
